dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: What to look out for from Mag 7 earnings, including Nvidia and Tesla
News Content: The latest earnings season has gotten off to a strong start, with investor attention turning to the "Magnificent 7" tech giants to see if their results can add to this momentum.

The major tech stocks led market gains in 2024 and the question for investors now is whether they can continue to do so in 2025.

More specifically, the Magnificent 7 — Tesla, Meta, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet and Nvidia — were responsible for more than half of the S&P 500’s (^GSPC) 25% return in 2024.

Tech stocks were already poised to climb higher this year, with Donald Trump's return to the White House, given his pledges to loosen regulations and cut taxes, as well as to invest heavily in AI.

Billionaire tech CEOs have also been flocking to forge closer ties with Trump, with many in attendance at his inauguration.

Read more: Best fund picks for investing in a Trump 2.0 presidency

In the first few days of Trump's second presidential term tech stocks rallied, after he unveiled a $500bn (£405bn) private-sector investment plan — known as the "Stargate" project — to build AI infrastructure in the US.

In a note on Wednesday, John Higgins, chief markets economist at Capital Economics, said: "Trump’s ringing endorsement of Stargate is another shot in the arm for AI in the early days of his second presidency, and supports our long-standing view that the S&P 500 will thrive in 2025 amid growing investment in, and enthusiasm for, this transformative technology."

Given this theme is set to continue to dominate markets this year, investors will be watching to see which of the Mag 7 stocks are leading the way on the AI trend, or if any are falling behind.

Here's what experts expect to see from the Mag 7 this earnings season.

Tesla (TSLA) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

Shares in electric vehicle (EV) maker Tesla have surged since Trump's election victory in November, with the stock becoming known as part of the "Trump trade", as CEO Elon Musk has become a close ally of the president.

Musk, who was a major supporter of Trump campaign, was appointed to lead the new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

The rally in Tesla shares comes despite the company reporting an annual delivery decline in early January for the first time in more than a decade. Tesla delivered 1.78 million vehicles in 2024, which was below analyst estimates of 1.8 million.

Tesla shares fell following the release of these figures and while Musk's expected role of influence on the incoming Trump administration saw the stock rise ahead of the inauguration, it fell back on the first full day of trading after the Republican president returned to office.

Story Continues

Read more: Stocks that are trending today

This came after Trump revoked a policy that mandated half of the new US cars manufactured be electric by 2030 and directed his administration to consider eliminating "unfair subsidies" on EVs.

Musk had said last year that he didn't think Tesla would be as impacted as competitors by the scrapping of subsidies and believed it could even help the company in the long term.

Despite these headwinds, analysts remain confident about the stock. Piper Sandler analyst Alexander Potter said he believed that Tesla would shift away from launching new EVs and focus on "popularising" its autonomous driving software, changing his price target on the stock to $500 from $315.

In terms of financial performance, Tesla posted third quarter revenue of $25.18bn, which was below estimates of $25.4bn. However, adjusted earnings per share of $0.72 came in ahead of an anticipated $0.60, and Tesla's closely-watched gross margin figure came in at 19.8%, much higher than the 16.8% expected.

As for Tesla outlook, the company said in its quarterly earnings deck that plans for new vehicles, including more affordable models, "remain on track for start of production in the first half of 2025".

•USD

(TSLA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Meta (META) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Facebook-owner Meta, is another tech leader that has been trying to build a closer relationship with Trump.

Meta committed $1m to Trump's inaugural fund and recently announced it had appointed Ultimate Fighting Championship CEO Dana White, an ally of Trump, as one of three new board members.

Zuckerberg also recently announced an end to the company's third-party fact-checking programme in the US, a move that was considered as part of a repositioning ahead of Trump's return to office.

Meta shares are up 62% over the past year, though the stock fell following the release of its third quarter earnings in October.

The company delivered earnings per share of $6.03, which bested estimates of $5.25 and revenue of $40.5bn beat forecasts of $40.2bn.

Read more: 6 crypto developments in 2025 that will keep fuelling bitcoin's rally

However, expectations were high going into this set of results and Meta guided to fourth quarter revenue guidance of between $45bn and $48bn for the quarter, compared to analyst forecasts of $46.09bn. The company also said it expects capital expenses to grow significantly in 2025.

Matt Britzman, senior equity analyst at Hargreaves Lansdown, said: "Meta has set itself apart among tech giants by turning AI investments into quick wins. Unlike cloud providers that sell AI capabilities, Meta focuses its efforts on enhancing its own products, driving higher ad revenue."

"That’s not to say the AI push comes cheap," he added. "Zuckerberg sees AI as a once-in-a-generation opportunity, and the spending reflects that ambition. Investment will be watched closely, with some $15bn needed to be spent over the quarter to achieve full-year spending plans.

"Investors, understandably cautious after Meta’s past overspending on projects like the metaverse, will be laser-focused on investment plans for 2025."

•USD

(META)

Follow  View Quote Details

Microsoft (MSFT) — reports on Wednesday 29 January

As the Stargate project was unveiled, Microsoft said it signed a new agreement with OpenAI, which included "changes to the exclusivity on new capacity".

Microsoft has been OpenAI's biggest backer and has provided data centre infrastructure for the ChatGPT maker to run its language models.

While this new agreement marks a shift in the arrangement between the two companies, Microsoft was still named as one of the key initial technology partners on Stargate.

The company also recently said it planned to spend $80bn on AI in this fiscal year. Microsoft has also been among the tech companies to jump into the trend of digital agents powered by AI.

In October, Microsoft announced the rollout of its Copilot features, which aim to enhance business productivity by automating routine administrative tasks.

Futurum Group CEO Daniel Newman told Yahoo Finance in December that he projected AI agents represent a $4tn annual global market opportunity over the next five years, describing it as "a massive opportunity" for companies.

Read more: FTSE housing stocks set to benefit from property market rebound

In terms of broader company performance, Microsoft's fiscal first quarter results beat expectations. The company reported earnings per share of $3.30, versus forecasts of $3.10 and revenue of $65.6bn also topped expectations of $64.5bn.

However, market reaction was downbeat, given mixed guidance on the earnings call. There were concerns around pressure on company profit margins in second quarter given the ramp up in AI spending.

Shares have had a bumpy ride over the past year, capping gains at nearly 12%.

Britzman said that the key metric to watch in the second quarter results was growth in its cloud computing Azure business, which is expected to come in at 31% to 32%.

"Microsoft has said more recently that its capacity constraints are resolved, so markets hope to get a better picture of current demand levels in the coming quarters," he said. "Beyond Azure, the rollout of Copilot will also be under scrutiny, with investors eager to see how product development and adoption are progressing after some criticism from peers."

•USD

(MSFT)

Follow  View Quote Details

Apple (AAPL) — reports on Thursday 30 January

Shares in Apple have come under pressure recently, amid disappointing news around its iPhone market share.

Apple's stock has suffered two analyst rating downgrades this week alone. Jefferies (JEF) analyst Edison Lee lowered the investment bank's rating on Apple shares to "underperform" and decreased his price target on the stock by 13% to $200.75.

Lee said in an investor note that he expected Apple's first quarter results — which are due out next week — to come in below expectations, and for the company to miss against estimates for the second quarter on weak iPhone sales and a lack of interest in AI among consumers.

Meanwhile, Loop Capital downgraded Apple from "buy" to "hold" and lowered its price target on the stock from $275 to $230.

Meanwhile, Counterpoint Research found sales of Apple's iPhones fell 18.2% in China in the December quarter, according to a Bloomberg report. The research also showed that the iPhone gave up its title of the top selling smartphone handsets in China to Huawei Technologies.

Read more: Funds for investors to watch in 2025

And data from from market analyst firm Canalys showed that Apple lost its top spot as the smartphone maker with the biggest market share in mainland China.

The recent fall in the Apple's shares, has seen the company's market valuation down decline to $3.41tn, and chipmaker Nvidia overtake it once again as the world's most valuable company, with a market capitalisation of $3.55tn.

In the fourth quarter, Apple reported earnings per share of $0.97 on revenue on revenue of $94.9bn. The company said it saw a one-time charge related to the reversal of a European General Court decision that requires Apple to pay €13bn to Ireland for back taxes.

Without the charge, EPS would have come in at $1.64. That would have blown past expectations of $1.59 per share and revenue of $94.3bn.

•USD

(AAPL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Amazon (AMZN) — reports on Thursday 30 January

A major focus for Amazon's fourth quarter results next week will be its cloud business, Amazon Web Services (AWS).

Revenue for this part of the business came in at $27.5bn in the third quarter, which was in line with Wall Street expectations, but was still up 19% year-on-year.

Shares popped following the release of Amazon's third quarter results, as it posted earnings per share of $1.43, which was ahead of estimates of $1.16. Revenue of $158.9bn also beat expectations of $157.29bn.

Investors also cheered Amazon's guidance for the fourth quarter, with the company expecting net sales to come in at between $181.5bn and $188.5bn.

Stocks: Create your watchlist and portfolio

Amazon is expecting to report operating income of between $16bn and $20bn, against the $13.2bn it reported for the same period in 2023.

Hargreaves Lansdown's Briztman said: "As usual, AWS will be the cloud hanging over market sentiment — any growth materially above 19% should get a warm reception. Investors will also be tuned in for updates on AWS’s AI initiatives and the eye-popping investment Amazon plans to spend in the space."

"Meanwhile, let’s not forget Amazon’s trusty old e-commerce arm, often overshadowed by its cloud cousin," he added. "For the first time in a while, it’s showing signs of life, with fresh initiatives like the discount storefront ‘Amazon Haul’ helping expand its reach. If Amazon can fine-tune automation, there’s potential for some tasty margin expansion too."

•USD

(AMZN)

Follow  View Quote Details

Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG) — reports on Tuesday 4 February

Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google-owner Alphabet, was another tech leader in attendance at Trump's inauguration.

A day later, Business Insider reported that Alphabet's chief investment officer Ruth Porat said at the World Economic Forum in Davos that there's a "tremendous amount of opportunity" to work with Trump in his second term.

These comments come after Alphabet has been grappling with regulatory headwinds over the past year. In November, the US Department of Justice (DOJ) asked that Google be forced to sell off its Chrome browser, as part of proposed remedies aimed at ending the company's dominance in internet search.

This filing came after a judge ruled in favour of prosecutors in a landmark trial in August, who argued that that Google ran its search engine empire as an illegal monopoly. The judge will will now decide what should happen next in a separate "remedies" phase of the trial that is expected to start this year.

Read more: Stocks to watch in European luxury and retail in 2025, according to Deutsche Bank

When Trump was asked in an interview in October about whether he believed Google should be broken up, he said: "Google’s got a lot of power. They’re very bad to me."

While Trump didn't go into specifics when asked if he would break up the business, he said: "I’d do something."

Despite regulatory concerns, Alphabet has continued to show strong performance, with the company smashing estimates in its third quarter results. Alphabet posted earnings per share of $2.12, compared to expectations of $1.83 and revenue of $88.27bn came in well ahead of estimates of $86.44bn.

Looking ahead to the fourth quarter, Britzman said that having "arrived fashionably late to the AI party, Alphabet is now making a splash. AI-powered overviews in Google search are starting to show their value, and investors will be laser-focused on ad revenue, still the core growth driver with a 9.5% uplift expected from [the] fourth-quarter results."

•USD

(GOOGL)

Follow  View Quote Details

Nvidia (NVDA) — reports on Wednesday 26 February

Market darling Nvidia will be the last of the Mag 7 to report, with investors eagerly anticipating the earnings for signals on the strength of AI chip demand.

Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang was one of the few tech execs not to attend Trump's inauguration, though the company was another named as a key initial technology partners on the Stargate project.

Shares in Nvidia are up a whopping 145% over the past year, though increasingly high expectations mean markets have become highly sensitive to any disappointing news around the chipmaker.

Read more: Surprising UK pay growth could delay Bank of England’s interest rate cuts

The stock dipped following the release of its third quarter results, even though Nvidia beat estimates on key metrics. Revenue of $35.1bn was comfortably ahead of analysts estimates of $33.2bn and earnings per share came in at $0.81 beat expectations of $0.74.

However, gross margins were lower quarter-on-quarter from 75.1% to 74.6%.

In addition, Nvidia guided to revenue of $37.5bn for the fourth quarter, plus or minus 2%, which would be just ahead of Wall Street expectations of $37bn.

Even so, analysts remain bullish on Nvidia, with Barclays (BARC.L) keeping an "overweight" rating on the stock and raising its price target on the stock from $160 to $175.

•USD

(NVDA)

Follow  View Quote Details

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.7, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.3, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive market sentiment with US equity markets surging during Trump's first week back in office. This generally bodes well for major tech stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), as they are often seen as leaders in the market. The comparison of FANG and Magnificent Seven stocks suggests a favorable environment for tech companies. Given the overall bullish sentiment and the historical performance of tech stocks during similar market conditions, there is a higher probability of AAPL's stock price rising rather than falling.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed outlook for Apple (AAPL). While the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts), Apple specifically faces headwinds. Analyst downgrades due to weak iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI interest are significant concerns. The loss of market share in China to Huawei is also a negative factor. While the company beat expectations in the fourth quarter, the current sentiment and near-term outlook are bearish. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article focuses on several companies reporting earnings next week, including Apple. While the article doesn't directly provide positive or negative news specifically about Apple's upcoming earnings report, the overall market sentiment is mixed.  The mention of Trump's return to office and potential policy changes introduces uncertainty.  The chip sector news (ASML and Intel) is mixed, with ASML facing challenges and Intel undergoing a CEO transition.  The luxury sector shows some positive signs, but this is not directly related to Apple.  Therefore, the probability of Apple's stock price moving significantly up or down due to *this specific news article* is relatively low.  The probability is more likely to be influenced by the actual earnings report itself, which is not covered in this news.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news headline indicates that tech stocks, including the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK), were falling late Friday afternoon. Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a major component of the tech sector and is likely to be affected by broader sector trends. Given the negative sentiment and downward movement in the tech sector, it is reasonable to infer that AAPL's stock price may also experience downward pressure. However, without specific details about AAPL's performance or additional context from the premium article, the analysis is limited to the general sector trend.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news article discusses five stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), in a Q&A session on the Zacks Market Edge Podcast. For Apple, the article mentions that the stock has declined 11.3% year-to-date and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). Additionally, it notes that Apple's forward P/E ratio is 30.1, which is considered high. However, the article poses a question about whether Apple would be a buying opportunity if it falls further. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, but it does not provide a direct recommendation to buy or sell. Given the current performance and valuation, there seems to be a higher likelihood of the stock price falling rather than rising.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's worst start to the year since 2008, with an 11% decline in stock price. The stock is approaching a key technical level, the 200-day moving average, which could signal further downside if breached. Analysts predict further declines, with a potential target of $208 based on technical analysis. However, the upcoming quarterly earnings report on January 30 could be a catalyst for a rebound if Apple beats analyst expectations. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price falling seems higher than the probability of it rising in the short term.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple is making significant efforts to improve its AI and Siri technologies by appointing a seasoned executive, Kim Vorrath, to lead these initiatives. This suggests that Apple is committed to addressing its perceived weaknesses in AI, which could potentially enhance its competitive position in the tech industry. However, the immediate impact on the stock price might be limited given the long-term nature of these improvements.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive market sentiment with US equity markets surging during Trump's first week back in office, which generally bodes well for major tech stocks like Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, there are mixed signals regarding Apple's specific performance, including concerns about iPhone sales and competition from Huawei. The overall bullish sentiment in the market suggests a higher probability of AAPL's stock price rising, but the negative factors specific to Apple temper this optimism. Therefore, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising, balanced by significant concerns that could lead to a fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts), Apple specifically faces headwinds. Analyst downgrades due to weak iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI interest are significant concerns. The loss of market share in China to Huawei is also a negative factor. Considering the previous predictions, there is a trend of negative sentiment towards Apple. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The provided news article is largely focused on other companies' earnings reports and broader market trends, offering little specific information about Apple's upcoming earnings or prospects.  While the overall market sentiment is mixed (positive due to Trump's return, but negative in some sectors like chips and luxury goods), this is not directly indicative of Apple's performance.  Previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, highlighting the uncertainty surrounding AAPL's short-term movement.  The lack of specific Apple-related news in this article suggests that the probability of a significant price movement (up or down) solely due to this news is low.  The actual earnings report will be the primary driver of price changes next week. Therefore, I'm assigning probabilities closer to neutral, reflecting the uncertainty.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news headline indicates a general downtrend in tech stocks, specifically mentioning the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) which includes Apple Inc. (AAPL). This suggests a broader negative sentiment affecting the tech sector, likely impacting AAPL's stock price. Given the lack of positive catalysts or company-specific news in the headline, the probability of the stock price falling is higher than it rising in the short term. Previous predictions also lean towards a higher probability of AAPL's stock price falling, aligning with the negative sector trend.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's stock performance and mentions that it has declined 11.3% year-to-date with a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). The forward P/E ratio is 30.1, which is considered high. However, the article poses a question about whether Apple would be a buying opportunity if it falls further. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, but it does not provide a direct recommendation to buy or sell. Given the current performance and valuation, there seems to be a higher likelihood of the stock price falling rather than rising. However, considering the general market sentiment and the fact that Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock, there is still a possibility for the stock price to rise if it attracts buyers at lower levels.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's worst start to the year since 2008, with an 11% decline in stock price. The stock is approaching a key technical level, the 200-day moving average, which could signal further downside if breached. Analysts predict further declines, with a potential target of $208 based on technical analysis. However, the upcoming quarterly earnings report on January 30 could be a catalyst for a rebound if Apple beats analyst expectations. Considering these factors, as well as the mixed predictions from other models, the probability of the stock price falling seems slightly higher than the probability of it rising in the short term.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.6, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The appointment of Kim Vorrath, a seasoned executive known for her ability to manage complex software projects and improve product development, to oversee AI and Siri enhancements at Apple indicates a strategic focus on improving core competencies in artificial intelligence. This news reflects Apple's commitment to catching up with leading tech companies in AI and enhancing its product offerings. Such strategic moves typically instill investor confidence, suggesting a positive outlook for the company's future performance.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news indicates a positive market sentiment with US equity markets surging during Trump's first week back in office, which generally bodes well for major tech stocks like Apple Inc. (AAPL). However, there are mixed signals regarding Apple's specific performance, including concerns about iPhone sales and competition from Huawei. The overall bullish sentiment in the market suggests a higher probability of AAPL's stock price rising, but the negative factors specific to Apple temper this optimism. Given the mixed predictions from previous rounds, I estimate a moderate probability of the stock price rising, balanced by significant concerns that could lead to a fall.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts), Apple specifically faces headwinds. Analyst downgrades due to weak iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI interest are significant concerns. The loss of market share in China to Huawei is also a negative factor. Considering the previous predictions, there is a trend of negative sentiment towards Apple. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise. However, the fact that it is part of the 'Magnificent 7' and the overall market is bullish, it is unlikely to fall too much.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article provides a mixed outlook for the market and Apple specifically. While the return of President Trump and the upcoming earnings reports of several major tech companies ('Magnificent Seven') could create a generally positive market sentiment, there are several factors that could negatively impact Apple's stock price.  These include concerns about weakening iPhone sales, competition from Huawei, and the overall mixed performance of the chip sector (as indicated by ASML and Intel's situations).  The previous predictions show a wide range of opinions, highlighting the uncertainty surrounding AAPL's short-term movement.  The article itself offers little specific information about Apple's upcoming earnings report, which will likely be the primary driver of price changes. Considering the mixed market sentiment, the lack of specific positive news for Apple, and the previous predictions leaning slightly towards a price fall, I assign a slightly higher probability to a price fall than a rise. However, the probability is not drastically skewed in either direction due to the overall uncertainty.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news headline indicates a general downtrend in tech stocks, specifically mentioning the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK) which includes Apple Inc. (AAPL). This suggests a broader negative sentiment affecting the tech sector, likely impacting AAPL's stock price. Previous predictions from other models also lean towards a higher probability of AAPL's stock price falling, aligning with the negative sector trend. However, Apple's strategic moves, such as the appointment of Kim Vorrath to oversee AI and Siri enhancements, could instill some investor confidence. Balancing these factors, the probability of the stock price falling is slightly higher than it rising in the short term.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses five stocks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), in a Q&A session on the Zacks Market Edge Podcast. For Apple, the article mentions that the stock has declined 11.3% year-to-date and has a Zacks Rank of 4 (Sell). Additionally, it notes that Apple's forward P/E ratio is 30.1, which is considered high. However, the article poses a question about whether Apple would be a buying opportunity if it falls further. The overall tone is neutral to slightly negative, but it does not provide a direct recommendation to buy or sell. Considering the current performance and valuation, there seems to be a higher likelihood of the stock price falling rather than rising. However, the general market sentiment and the fact that Apple is a Magnificent 7 stock might provide some support for the stock price. Previous predictions from various models show a mixed outlook, with a slight inclination towards a higher probability of the stock price falling.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.42, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.58, Reasoning: The news article discusses Apple's worst start to the year since 2008, with an 11% decline in stock price, and the stock is approaching a key technical level, the 200-day moving average, which could signal further downside if breached. Analysts predict further declines, with a potential target of $208 based on technical analysis. However, the upcoming quarterly earnings report on January 30 could be a catalyst for a rebound if Apple beats analyst expectations. Considering these factors, as well as the mixed predictions from other models, the probability of the stock price falling seems slightly higher than the probability of it rising in the short term. The overall market sentiment is positive, but Apple specifically faces headwinds, including weak iPhone sales and competition from Huawei. The trend of previous predictions also indicates a higher likelihood of the stock price falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news indicates that Apple has appointed Kim Vorrath, an experienced executive known for handling complex software projects, to lead AI and Siri improvements. This strategic move signals Apple's commitment to enhancing its AI capabilities, which could positively influence investor confidence. However, the previous predictions from various models suggest a mixture of positive and negative sentiments, with most leaning towards a higher probability of the stock price falling due to concerns such as weak iPhone sales, competition from rivals, and high valuations. Taking into account the mixed signals and the positive nature of the news about AI improvements, the overall probability remains moderately positive.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While the broader market sentiment is positive due to the 'Magnificent 7' and potential benefits from a Trump presidency (AI investments, deregulation, tax cuts), Apple specifically faces headwinds. Analyst downgrades due to weak iPhone sales and a perceived lack of AI interest are significant concerns. The loss of market share in China to Huawei is also a negative factor. The appointment of Kim Vorrath to lead AI and Siri improvements is a positive sign, but its impact is uncertain in the short term. Considering the previous predictions, there is a trend of negative sentiment towards Apple. Therefore, the probability of a stock price fall is higher than a rise. However, the fact that it is part of the 'Magnificent 7' and the overall market is bullish, it is unlikely to fall too much.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "What to look out for from Mag 7 earnings, including Nvidia and Tesla",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.4,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.6
}
```
